fields.description: The currently available spaces at this vehicle parking.

fields.name: bicyclePlaces
fields.description: Does this vehicle parking have spaces (capacity) for bicycles.

fields.name: capacity
fields.description: The capacity (maximum available spaces) of this vehicle parking.

fields.name: carPlaces
fields.description:
Does this vehicle parking have spaces (capacity) for cars excluding wheelchair accessible spaces.
Use anyCarPlaces to check if any type of car may use this vehicle parking.

fields.name: detailsUrl
fields.description: URL which contains details of this vehicle parking.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: imageUrl
fields.description: URL of an image which may be displayed to the user showing the vehicle parking.

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the bike park (WGS 84)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the bike park (WGS 84)

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the park

args.name: language
args.description: Returns name with the specified language, if found, otherwise returns with some default language.

fields.name: note
fields.description: A short translatable note containing details of this vehicle parking.

args.name: language
args.description: Returns note with the specified language, if found, otherwise returns with some default language.

fields.name: openingHours
fields.description: Opening hours of the parking facility

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: If true, value of `spacesAvailable` is updated from a real-time source.

fields.name: state
fields.description:
The state of this vehicle parking.
Only ones in an OPERATIONAL state may be used for Park and Ride.

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
Source specific tags of the vehicle parking, which describe the available features. For example
park_and_ride, bike_lockers, or static_osm_data.

fields.name: vehicleParkingId
fields.description: ID of the park

fields.name: wheelchairAccessibleCarPlaces
fields.description: Does this vehicle parking have wheelchair accessible (disabled) car spaces (capacity).

types.name: VehicleParkingInput
types.description: Preferences for parking facilities used during the routing.

inputFields.name: filters
inputFields.description:
Selection filters to include or exclude parking facilities.
An empty list will include all facilities in the routing search.

inputFields.name: preferred
inputFields.description:
If non-empty every parking facility that doesn't match this set of conditions will
receive an extra cost (defined by `unpreferredCost`) and therefore avoided.

inputFields.name: unpreferredCost
inputFields.description:
If `preferred` is non-empty, using a parking facility that doesn't contain
at least one of the preferred conditions, will receive this extra cost and therefore avoided if
preferred options are available.

types.name: VehicleParkingSpaces
types.description: The number of spaces by type. null if unknown.

fields.name: bicycleSpaces
fields.description: The number of bicycle spaces.

fields.name: carSpaces
fields.description: The number of car spaces.

fields.name: wheelchairAccessibleCarSpaces
fields.description: The number of wheelchair accessible (disabled) car spaces.

types.name: VehicleParkingState
types.description:
The state of the vehicle parking. TEMPORARILY_CLOSED and CLOSED are distinct states so that they
may be represented differently to the user.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: Can't be used for park and ride.

enumValues.name: OPERATIONAL
enumValues.description: May be used for park and ride.

enumValues.name: TEMPORARILY_CLOSED
enumValues.description: Can't be used for park and ride.

types.name: VehiclePosition
types.description: Real-time vehicle position

fields.name: heading
fields.description:
Bearing, in degrees, clockwise from North, i.e., 0 is North and 90 is East. This can be the
compass bearing, or the direction towards the next stop or intermediate location.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Human-readable label of the vehicle, eg. a publicly visible number or a license plate

fields.name: lastUpdated
fields.description: When the position of the vehicle was recorded in seconds since the UNIX epoch.

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the vehicle

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the vehicle

fields.name: speed
fields.description: Speed of the vehicle in meters/second

fields.name: stopRelationship
fields.description: The current stop where the vehicle will be or is currently arriving.

fields.name: trip
fields.description: Which trip this vehicles runs on.

fields.name: vehicleId
fields.description: Feed-scoped ID that uniquely identifies the vehicle in the format FeedId:VehicleId

types.name: VehicleRentalNetwork
types.description:
Vehicle rental network, which is referred as system in the GBFS terminology. Note, the same operator can operate in multiple
regions either with the same network/system or with a different one. This can contain information about either the rental brand
or about the operator.

fields.name: networkId
fields.description:
ID of the vehicle rental network. In GBFS, this is the `system_id` field from the system information, but it can
be overridden in the configuration to have a different value so this field doesn't necessarily match the source data.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The rental vehicle operator's network/system URL. In GBFS, this is the `url` field from the system information.

types.name: VehicleRentalStation
types.description: Vehicle rental station represents a location where users can rent bicycles etc. for a fee.

fields.name: allowDropoff
fields.description:
If true, vehicles can be returned to this station if the station has spaces available
or allows overloading.

fields.name: allowDropoffNow
fields.description: If true, vehicles can be currently returned to this station.

fields.name: allowOverloading
fields.description: If true, vehicles can be returned even if spacesAvailable is zero or vehicles > capacity.

fields.name: allowPickup
fields.description: If true, vehicles can be picked up from this station if the station has vehicles available.

fields.name: allowPickupNow
fields.description: If true, vehicles can be currently picked up from this station.

fields.name: availableSpaces
fields.description: Number of free spaces currently available on the rental station, grouped by vehicle type.

fields.name: availableVehicles
fields.description: Number of vehicles currently available on the rental station, grouped by vehicle type.

fields.name: capacity
fields.description: Nominal capacity (number of racks) of the rental station.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global object ID provided by Relay. This value can be used to refetch this object using **node** query.

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the vehicle rental station (WGS 84)

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the vehicle rental station (WGS 84)

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the vehicle rental station

fields.name: network
fields.description: ID of the rental network.

fields.name: operative
fields.description: If true, station is on and in service.

fields.name: realtime
fields.description:
If true, values of `vehiclesAvailable` and `spacesAvailable` are updated from a
real-time source. If false, values of `vehiclesAvailable` and `spacesAvailable`
are always the total capacity divided by two.

fields.name: rentalNetwork
fields.description: The vehicle rental network information. This is referred as system in the GBFS terminology.

fields.name: rentalUris
fields.description: Platform-specific URLs to begin renting a vehicle from this station.

fields.name: spacesAvailable
fields.description:
Number of free spaces currently available on the rental station.
Note that this value being 0 does not necessarily indicate that vehicles cannot be returned
to this station, as for example it might be possible to leave the vehicle in the vicinity of
the rental station, even if the vehicle racks don't have any spaces available.
See field `allowDropoffNow` to know if is currently possible to return a vehicle.
fields.deprecationReason: Use `availableSpaces` instead, which also contains the space vehicle types

fields.name: stationId
fields.description: ID of the vehicle in the format of network:id

fields.name: vehiclesAvailable
fields.description:
Number of vehicles currently available on the rental station.
See field `allowPickupNow` to know if is currently possible to pick up a vehicle.
fields.deprecationReason: Use `availableVehicles` instead, which also contains vehicle types

fields.name: android
fields.description:
A URI that can be passed to an Android app with an {@code android.intent.action.VIEW} Android
intent to support Android Deep Links.
May be null if a rental URI does not exist.

fields.name: ios
fields.description:
A URI that can be used on iOS to launch the rental app for this rental network.
May be {@code null} if a rental URI does not exist.

fields.name: web
fields.description:
A URL that can be used by a web browser to show more information about renting a vehicle.
May be {@code null} if a rental URL does not exist.

types.name: VehicleStopStatus
types.description: How close the vehicle is to the stop.

enumValues.name: INCOMING_AT
enumValues.description: The vehicle is just about to arrive at the stop (on a stop display, the vehicle symbol typically flashes).

enumValues.name: IN_TRANSIT_TO
enumValues.description: The vehicle has departed the previous stop and is in transit.

enumValues.name: STOPPED_AT
enumValues.description: The vehicle is standing at the stop.

enumValues.name: BIKEPARK
enumValues.description: BIKEPARK

enumValues.name: BIKESHARE
enumValues.description: BIKESHARE

enumValues.name: NORMAL
enumValues.description: NORMAL

enumValues.name: PARKANDRIDE
enumValues.description: PARKANDRIDE

enumValues.name: TRANSIT
enumValues.description: TRANSIT

types.name: WalkPreferencesInput
types.description: Preferences related to walking (excluding walking a bicycle or a scooter).

inputFields.name: boardCost
inputFields.description: The cost of boarding a vehicle while walking.

inputFields.name: reluctance
inputFields.description: A multiplier for how bad walking is compared to being in transit for equal lengths of time.

inputFields.name: safetyFactor
inputFields.description:
Factor for how much the walk safety is considered in routing. Value should be between 0 and 1.
If the value is set to be 0, safety is ignored.

inputFields.name: speed
inputFields.description:
Maximum walk speed on flat ground. Note, this speed is higher than the average speed
will be in itineraries as this is the maximum speed but there are
factors that slow down walking such as crossings, intersections and elevation changes.

enumValues.name: NOT_POSSIBLE
enumValues.description: Wheelchair boarding is not possible at this stop.

enumValues.name: NO_INFORMATION
enumValues.description: There is no accessibility information for the stop.

enumValues.name: POSSIBLE
enumValues.description: At least some vehicles at this stop can be boarded by a rider in a wheelchair.

types.name: WheelchairPreferencesInput
types.description:
Wheelchair related preferences. Note, this is the only from of accessibilty available
currently and is sometimes is used for other accessibility needs as well.

inputFields.name: enabled
inputFields.description:
Is wheelchair accessibility considered in routing. Note, this does not guarantee
that the itineraries are wheelchair accessible as there can be data issues.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: async
directives.description:
Use an asynchronous data fetcher on a separate thread for this field.

This is useful when adding several queries in the same HTTP request, for example by using a batch: Those
fields annotated with this directive run in parallel.

This is only worth it when the execution is long running, i.e. more than ~50 milliseconds, so this doesn't happen by default.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field, argument, input field or enum value as deprecated

args.name: reason
args.description: The reason for the deprecation

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Exactly one of the fields on an input object must be set and non-null while all others are omitted.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
